block.p: Teresa Kathryn Goebel, a daughter of Kathryn W. Fuller of Duluth, Minn., and Louis E. Goebel of San Diego, is to be married today to Michael Andrew Zwibelman, the son of Bonnie and Myron Zwibelman of St. Louis. Rabbi Ben Leinow is to perform the ceremony at the Loews Coronado Bay Resort in Coronado, Calif. The Rev. Carolyn Owen-Towle and the Rev. Thomas Owen-Towle, Unitarian Universalist ministers, will take part in the ceremony.
The couple received law degrees from the University of Chicago.

Teresa Kathryn Goebel, a daughter of Kathryn W. Fuller of Duluth, Minn., and Louis E. Goebel of San Diego, is to be married today to Michael Andrew Zwibelman, the son of Bonnie and Myron Zwibelman of St. Louis. Rabbi Ben Leinow is to perform the ceremony at the Loews Coronado Bay Resort in Coronado, Calif. The Rev. Carolyn Owen-Towle and the Rev. Thomas Owen-Towle, Unitarian Universalist ministers, will take part in the ceremony.
The couple received law degrees from the University of Chicago.

The bride, 28, is keeping her name. She was until last month a clerk for Judge David S. Tatel of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit in Washington. In October, she is to become an associate at Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz, the New York law firm. She graduated magna cum laude from Brown University. Her father is a lawyer in San Diego. Her mother is a librarian at the University of Minnesota in Duluth. The bride's stepmother, Chris Frahm, is of counsel to Hatch & Parent, a law firm in San Diego.

Mr. Zwibelman, 27, is a lawyer in the voting rights section of the Civil Rights Division of the Justice Department in Washington. He graduated from Stanford and received a master's degree in public affairs from Princeton. His mother is the vice chairwoman of 100 Neediest Cases, a charitable organization in St. Louis. His father is a partner in Walther/Glenn Law Associates in St. Louis.
